name: JB Poker
overview: JB Poker was designed to emulate the poker-playing machines commonly seen in pubs, especially the one overused to the point of poverty of JB, the friend of the game's creator. You start the game with 10 each of $1 coins. You can enter 1 to 5 credits into the slight at right for each deal. If you change your mind before the deal, just hit the eject button. You can turn over any of the cards by clicking on them. Press deal again and the upside down cards will be replaced with new ones from the deck. Junk cards: lose your credits One pair, of 2's or 10's: you lose your credits One pair, of J, Q, K or A: you keep your credits Two pairs: you double your credits 3 of a kind: you get 5 times your credits Straight: you get 8 times your credits Flush: you get 12 times your credits Full House: you get 25 times your credits 4 of a kind: you get 50 times your credits Straight Flush: you get 75 times your credits Royal Flush: you get 100 times your credits.
